Dear Ms. Taylor:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Jessica VandenHeuvel at 616-204-6992.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Youth restraint; pregnant youth; reduction, prevention; prohibited
Title restraints; elimination of restraints.
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4159
Section (5) In the event a restraint occurs, it must be performed in a
Description manner that is safe, appropriate, and proportionate to the severity
of the youth’s behavior, chronological and developmental age,
size, gender, physical condition, medical condition, psychiatric
condition, and personal history, including any history of trauma,
and must be done in a manner consistent with the youth’s
treatment plan.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 4/18/24, youth was having a psychotic episode and raised
their hand to attack staff. A staff attempted a behavior technique
and the youth fell to the floor. The staff continued to physically
engage the youth with their hand near the youth's neck. The youth
was taken for a psychiatric evaluation and the staff was
terminated.
Investigation Interviews:
Vice President of Residential Treatment was interviewed via
telephone on April 19, 2024, and reported they had no
additional information.
Chief Administrator was interviewed face-to-face at the
facility on May 13, 2024, in collaboration with MDHHS worker
and Law Enforcement. Chief Administrator said she was called
by Supervisor X to Clarence Fischer building due to Youth A being
2

upset. Chief Administrator said when she arrived Supervisor Z,
Staff 1, Staff 3, Staff 4, and Staff 5 were all near Youth A working
with him on deescalating. Chief Administrator said at no point
when she was present did Supervisor Z restrain Youth A. Chief
Administrator said Youth A was making threats and screaming that
staff were raping him and “fucking him up” when no one was
touching him. Chief Administrator said Youth A had a mark on his
finger from pulling Staff 1’s key cord, bites on his right arm that
were self-inflicted, scratches on his neck, and his nose was
bleeding. Chief Administrator said she was told Youth A had been
running into the walls, doors, and flopping around on the ground
which was why he had the bloody nose. Chief Administrator said
she has not had previous concerns or issues with Supervisor Z.
Chief Administrator said after the incident Staff 1 reported to her
that Supervisor Z had been choking Youth A on the ground. Chief
Administrator said she immediately watched the footage and
terminated Supervisor Z. Chief Administrator said when youth are
on a safety plan for suicidal ideations they cannot go outside if
dysregulated or making self-harm statements for safety reasons.
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on May 13,
2024, in collaboration with MDHHS worker and Law
Enforcement. Youth A said he has been at Clarence Fischer
Center for about one month and recalled Supervisor Z working
with him “once and a while”. Youth A said during his placement at
Clarence Fischer Center, Supervisor Z restrained him twice. Youth
A said the first time was on the unit (Investigated under
2024SIC0001268) and the second time in the hallway by the door
that exits the building. Youth A said during the second restraint
with Supervisor Z he was attempting to go outside to “calm down”
and pushed past Supervisor Z who pushed him onto the floor and
placed him in a restraint. Youth A first said he could not remember
if any other staff were present then later stated Staff 1, Staff 4, and
Chief Administrator were all in the hallway when this occurred.
Youth A said Supervisor Z had both his hands on Youth A’s chest
and pushed him to the ground, noting Supervisor Z’s push “was
hard but not really forcefully”. Youth A said he landed on the
ground on his back and was not hurt. Youth A said while on the
ground, Supervisor Z was holding his hands on Youth A’s chest,
denying Supervisor Z’s hands being around his neck. Youth A said
he remembered being out of breath stating he was unsure why,
however denied being choked by Supervisor Z. Youth A said
Supervisor Z had his knee on Youth A’s stomach/chest area. Youth
A denied Supervisor Z saying anything to him during the restraint
on the ground. Youth A said during the restraint he was screaming
that he wanted to go outside. Youth A said he does not remember
3

how any of the incident ended. Youth A denied being harmed by
Supervisor Z. Youth A said he feels safe at Clarence Fisher
Center.
Youth B was interviewed via TEAMS on May 23, 2024, in
collaboration with MDHHS worker. Youth B said he remembers
the day that Youth A was upset and in the hallway near the doors.
Youth B said Youth A was being aggressive to the staff in the
hallway, trying to get out the doors. Youth B said Youth A was
kicking staff, hitting staff, and screaming “rape”. Youth B said no
staff were raping Youth A. He stated he saw Youth A laying on the
ground and the staff just standing around the area not touching
him. Youth B said he never saw any staff choke Youth A or
anywhere near his neck. Youth B said Supervisor Z was a “good”
staff and he never saw him hurt any youth.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on May 13,
2024, in collaboration with MDHHS worker. Staff 1 said he was
working in the classroom and heard Youth A yelling therefore
came into the hallway to assist. Staff 1 said Youth A ran down the
hallway and slammed himself into the wall and then into the door
and bounced back onto the ground. Staff 1 said Youth A was
acting erratic and was “flaying around” on the ground. Staff 1 said
Youth A was crawling on the ground and through staff’s legs,
pushing staff, kicking staff, and biting himself. Staff 1 said Youth A
“grabbed” Supervisor Z’s shirt and they both fell to the ground.
Staff 1 said Supervisor Z and Youth A were holding onto each
other while on the ground. Staff 1 said Supervisor Z had both of
his hands on Youth A’s neck/collar bone area and was trying to get
up. Staff 1 said he believed that it was an accidental hand
positioning by Supervisor Z as he was just trying to get away from
Youth A and did not appear to have malicious intent. Staff 1 said
he put one had on Youth A’s shoulder and the other hand on
Supervisor Z’s shoulder and separated them and Supervisor Z
stood up. Staff 1 said while Youth A and Supervisor Z were on the
ground, Supervisor Z was saying “let go of me, let me up” and
Youth A was holding Supervisor Z’s shirt yelling “get off of me”.
Staff 1 said he did not see Supervisor Z choke Youth A. Staff 1
said Supervisor Z did not use the proper technique for a release
as he should have taken ahold of Youth A’s wrist with one hand
and his own shirt with the other hand and apply the “pull push”
method by moving his shirt in one direction while moving Youth A’s
wrist in the opposite direction. Staff 1 said the “push/pull”
technique is what they are taught in restraint training. Staff 1 said
Chief Administrator entered the building and Youth A began to
deescalate and sat on the ground until the police arrived. Staff 1
4

said he has never had any prior concerns about Supervisor Z’s
interactions with youth, noting most staff and youth refer to him as
“preacher” because he spends so much time talking to the youth.
Staff 3 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on May 13,
2024, in collaboration with MDHHS worker and Law
Enforcement. Staff 3 said Youth A was upset and wanted to get
outside. Staff 3 said Youth A is on a safety plan due to his suicidal
and homicidal statements which prevents him from being allowed
outside. Staff 3 said he and Supervisor X were trying to use
proximity, clarifying he and Supervisor X were standing side by
side and would walk in front of Youth A’s path to get him to turn
and walk another way in attempts to get him to walk back to the
unit. Staff 3 said Supervisor Z became involved and was telling
Youth A to stop and make better choices. Staff 3 said Youth A hit
him and Youth B became upset and started to physically fight with
Youth A. Staff 3 said he and Supervisor Z got the youth apart and
Youth A ran at the door twice and hit it so hard he fell to the
ground. Staff 3 denied any staff touching him or pushing him
against the doors. Staff 3 said Youth A crawled between Staff 1’s
legs and began yelling “rape”, then grabbed Staff 1’s keys which
were on a retractable key chain and started to wrap the cord
around his arm. Staff 3 said he and Staff 1 were able to get Youth
A’s fingers unwrapped from the keys and get them away from him.
Staff 3 said he then went out of the building and used his backside
to hold the door closed from outdoors so that Youth A could not
keep pushing past staff and opening the door. Staff 3 said he
never saw Youth A and Supervisor Z on the ground. Staff 3 denied
seeing Supervisor Z’s hands around Youth A’s neck. Staff 3 said
he never saw Supervisor Z hurt a youth during any of their shifts
together.
Staff 4 was interviews via TEAMS on May 23, 2024, in
collaboration with MDHHS worker. Staff 4 said he is a youth
care work on third shift and did not work many shifts with
Supervisor Z. Staff 4 said he was finishing his shift the day Youth A
became upset. Staff 4 said Youth A refused to go to school and
was pacing the cafeteria between 7:30am and 8:00am. Staff 4
said Youth A attempted to get into a classroom that was not his
and staff stood in front of the door not allowing him to get inside,
so he turned and attempted to get outside. Staff 4 said Supervisor
X and Staff 3 blocked the doorway to prevent Youth A from exiting.
Staff 4 said he believed Staff 3 and Supervisor X attempted a
restraint at one point however Youth A dropped to the ground, and
they let him go. Staff 4 said once Youth A was on the ground he
was thrashing around, kicking staff, and making allegations that
5

staff were harming him despite no staff touching him. Staff 4 said
Youth A was acting very aggressively towards all the staff, and at
one point got through Staff 4’s legs and ran down the hallway and
ran right into the wall and then the door with so much force he fell
backward onto the ground and was screaming he was hurt. Staff 4
said Staff 1 was attempting to help Youth A and Youth A grabbed
his “key zip cord” and wrapped it around his neck, however Staff 1
was able to get it back from him without him being hurt. Staff 4
said Youth A then got up and ran into the door and bounced back
onto the floor and began yelling “PREA! RAPE!”. Staff 4 said
Youth A was biting himself, got up and ran into the door, grabbed
Supervisor Z, fell to the ground, pulling Supervisor Z with him.
Staff 4 said Supervisor Z got himself back up and stood back until
the police arrived with an ambulance to take Youth A to the
hospital. Staff 4 said he never saw Supervisor Z choke Youth A.
Staff 4 said he never saw Supervisor Z’s hands around or near
Youth A’s neck. Staff 4 denied seeing any of the staff being rough
with Youth A. Staff 4 said Youth A was on a one-on-one staffing
status and was unsafe to go outside when he was dysregulated
due to past behaviors of self-harm and running into traffic when
upset. Staff 4 said youth are allowed to go outside when on one-
on-one depending on the youth and the situation, in this situation it
was deemed unsafe to allow him out at that specific time due to
his behaviors.
Staff 5 was interviewed via TEAMS on May 23, 2024, in
collaboration with MDHHS worker. Staff 5 said he was working
with Youth B when Youth A began to get upset and “spaz out” and
kick staff, swing at staff, run into the doors and walls, and hit
himself. Staff 5 said he was in and out of the hallway area
assisting between Youth B and Youth A. Staff 5 said he saw Youth
A swing his arms at Supervisor Z and Supervisor Z attempt a
restraint and they both fell to the ground. Staff 5 said Youth A was
having “wild movements” while in the hallway both when he was
standing and on the ground. Staff 5 said Supervisor Z was on the
ground with Youth A for a moment but then was able to get back to
his feet. Staff 5 said Youth A continued to sit on the ground and
yell “rape” despite no staff being close enough to touch him. Staff
5 said he never saw Supervisor Z’s hand on Youth A’s neck. Staff
5 said he never saw Supervisor Z choke Youth A. Staff 5 said this
was the first time he has seen a restraint with Supervisor Z. Staff 5
said he has never seen any aggressive behaviors from Supervisor
Z and never had any concerns with the way Supervisor Z
interacted with the youth. Staff 5 said Youth A was attempting to
get outside however was on a one-to-one staff status and was
very upset so was not allowed to go outside in that state of mind.
6

Staff 5 said Youth A has a history of self-harming, and he was
threating to kill himself so they did not want him to get outside
where he could get away from staff’s presence and hurt himself.
Staff 5 said usually youth are always allowed outside even if they
have a one-on-one but in this situation Youth A was acting so
“wild” it would not have been safe.
Supervisor Z was called on May 13, 2024, in collaboration
with MDHHS worker and refused to be interviewed and hung
up the phone. Supervisor Z’s house was visited on May 13, 2024,
in collaboration with MDHHS and no one answered the door
therefore contact information was left. Supervisor Z was called
again on May 21, 2024, and did not answer the phone or return
the voicemail left for him. Supervisor Z contacted MDHHS worker
via telephone on May 28, 2024, and agreed to be interviewed at a
local McDonalds. Supervisor Z was interviewed via telephone by
me and face-to-face by MDHHS on June 4, 2024. Supervisor Z
said he was employed as a supervisor at Clarence Fischer Center
for about a year and a half. Supervisor Z said he was terminated
after administration said he broke policy and choked Youth A.
Supervisor Z denied choking Youth A. Supervisor Z said he was
working third shift when the incident occurred as it was right at the
end of his shift. Supervisor Z said he was getting ready to leave
when Youth A stated he was not going to school. Supervisor Z
said he and Staff 4 were blocking the door when Youth A began
running into the door and yelling, they are abusing him. Supervisor
Z said there were a few other staff in the hallway as well.
Supervisor Z said Youth A was hitting and kicking him and Staff 4
trying to get out the door and run away. Supervisor Z said Youth A
was on a safety plan at the time but was unable to remember
exactly what the plan said. Supervisor Z said Youth A wrapped his
legs around him and pulled him down. Supervisor Z said he
caught himself with his right hand and landed on his left knee.
Supervisor Z said he does not recall his hand being on Youth A
except to remove Youth A’s legs from around his leg. Supervisor Z
said he was just trying to get out of Youth A’s grasp and getting
back up. Supervisor Z said all the staff were getting hit throughout
this incident. Supervisor Z said he never purposely took Youth A to
the ground but rather Youth A was the one that pulled him to the
ground. Supervisor Z denied having his hand near Youth A’s neck
at any point. Supervisor Z said he does not remember having his
hand on Youth A’s chest and if it was it was only him trying to
brace himself from Youth A pulling on him and his attempt to get
back to his feet. Supervisor Z adamantly denied choking Youth A,
stating his knows he did not have his hands around Youth A’s
neck.
7

Supervisor X was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
May 13, 2024, in collaboration with MDHHS worker and Law
Enforcement. Supervisor X said she walked into the cafeteria and
Youth A was upset, throwing tables and chairs around. Supervisor
X said Youth A began to hit Staff 3 and she and Staff 3 began to
place Youth A in a high team restraint, each staff holding one of
Youth A’s arms, however he immediately dropped his weight so
they never got him in the high team restraint. Supervisor X said
Youth A stood up quickly and ran into the wall and then into the
door with his full force and fell back to the ground. Supervisor X
denied any staff pushing Youth A into either the wall or the door.
Supervisor X said Staff 1 came over to assist and Supervisor Z
and Staff 4 stood in front of the door. Supervisor X said she called
Chief Administrator for support and then called 911 for assistance.
Supervisor X said she stood in front of the staff office door so that
Youth A could not gain access to the office. Supervisor X said
Youth A grabbed Staff 1’s earpiece and put it in his mouth but the
spit it out and she took it. Supervisor X said Youth A continued to
attempt to get out of the door and was placed briefly in a restraint
by Staff 4 and Supervisor Z. Supervisor X said Youth A was
making many comments about being raped, having staff attempt
to kill him, and just screaming while on the floor in the hallway.
Supervisor X said Chief Administrator then arrived so she left the
hallway to continue to speak to the 911 operator. Supervisor X
said she never saw Supervisor Z on the ground with Youth A.
Supervisor X denied ever seeing Supervisor Z’s hands on Youth
A’s neck. Supervisor X said after the incident with Youth A, Staff 1
told her that he witnessed Supervisor Z with his hands around
Youth A’s neck as if to choke him. Supervisor X said she
immediately told Chief Administrator who intervened and took over
talking to Staff 1. Supervisor X said Youth A was on a safety plan
and was on a 1-on-1 staffing. Supervisor X said Youth A is on a 1-
1 for self-harm and cannot go outside if he is escalated due to
past issues of him hurting himself. Supervisor X said Youth A’s
safety plan is written for staff to review and kept in the supervisor’s
office. Supervisor X said all youth that are on 1-1’s cannot go
outside if they are dysregulated for safety purposes.
Video Reviewed:
Video footage of April 18, 2024, cafeteria and front hallway was
reviewed on April 19, 2024. The video footage of the cafeteria
shows Youth A pacing around the room. Staff 2, Staff 3, and Staff
5 are supervising and Youth B is sitting at the table. Youth A
moves out of camera view briefly with Youth B, Staff 2, Staff 3, and
Staff 5 following him. Youth A returns to the cafeteria and begins to
8

flip over tables and chairs. Staff 3 begins to pick them up and
Supervisor Z and Supervisor X arrive in cafeteria. Supervisor Z
begins to assist Staff 3 in removing the tables and chairs while
Supervisor X secures the medication cart in the supervisor’s
office. Staff 2 is seen leaving with Youth B. Youth A continues to
pace in and out of camera view. Supervisor X is seen walking to
the area off camera that Youth A moved into. Staff 4 and
Supervisor Z are seen walking off camera the same direction that
Youth A and the other staff went.
The video footage of the front hallway shows Youth A running from
the hallway with Supervisor X following him. Youth A runs directly
into the wall and then into the glass doorway with Supervisor X’s
hands near his back. Staff 3, Staff 4, and Supervisor Z are right
behind them. Youth A falls onto his back after running into the
glass widow. Youth A lays on the floor holding his face. Youth A
reaches up from the floor and pulls the fire alarm. Supervisor Z
pushes the alarm back in place. Youth A gets up, Supervisor Z
moves behind him to position himself between Youth A and the
front of the door, moving Youth A with his knee in a forward
motion. Supervisor X walks out of the hallway, Supervisor Z and
Staff 4 stand in front of the door. Staff 3 stands in the hallway on
the other side of Youth A. Youth B walks around the corner with
Staff 5 and Youth A sees him and immediately runs at him. Staff 3
and Staff 5 intervene and get between Youth A and Youth B while
Staff 4 and Supervisor Z move towards them and away from the
doorway. Youth A turns and runs back into the glass window and
falls to the floor holding his head. Youth B is then escorted by Staff
2 and Staff 5 out of the area. Staff 1 and Supervisor X return to the
hallway. Youth A is on the ground next to the doorway, Supervisor
Z and Staff 4 move to get between Youth A and the doorway.
Youth A is sitting on the floor. Staff 1, Staff 3, Staff 4, Supervisor X,
and Supervisor Z are surrounding him so he is not able to be seen
on camera. The front door is seen opening, Supervisor Z is bent
over in the doorway and is seen pulling Youth A inside, unable to
see what body parts Supervisor Z is holding, and Youth A’s body
hits the hallway wall. Youth A lays on the floor. Staff 5 stands in the
doorway. Youth B is seen outside near the door. Youth B comes to
the door from the outside and tries to get past Staff 5 who is
holding the door open. Youth A stands up and Youth A and Youth B
move towards each other. Staff 1, Staff 4, and Supervisor Z block
Youth A from the inside and Staff 5 moves Youth B away from the
door. Youth B is then able to get inside, and Youth A starts to
swing his arms at Youth B. Staff 4, Staff 5, and Supervisor Z get in
between the youth and Youth A falls to the ground and sits, while
Youth B walks out of the building. Youth A stands up and pushes
9

Staff 4 and Supervisor Z to get to the door and then falls to the
ground again. Youth A stands up and tries to push past Staff 1 in
the hallway however then turns and raises his arm with his fist
balled up at Supervisor Z. Supervisor Z takes hold of Youth A’s
forearm with his hands, and Youth A goes to the ground on his
back. Supervisor Z also goes to the ground and appears to be on
top of Youth A with his forearm on Youth A’s chest. Supervisor Z is
helped to his feet by Staff 1 and is seen putting his shoe back on.
Youth A lays on the floor grasping his neck, rolling around on the
ground. Youth A gets on his knees, punches at a Staff 1, tries to
crawl down the hallway between Supervisor X and Staff 1 but is
stopped with his head between their knees. Youth A lays on his
back and then sits back up, flops forward against a door and then
sits with his back against the door. Chief Administrator walks into
the hallway and stands with her back against the wall, looking at
Youth A and moving her mouth. Youth A grabs his own neck with
his right hand and is rocking back and forth while holding his neck,
stopping after about a minute. Youth A attempts to crawl past Staff
1 and Supervisor X. They stop him by standing in front of him.
Youth A then crawls around Staff 1 and he moves his legs in front
of Youth A. Youth A’s head connects with Staff 1’s leg and Youth A
goes to his back and holds his head briefly then gets to his knees
and stands up and runs towards the door and swings his arm at
Supervisor Z then falls backward on the ground. Youth A stands
and rushes to the door, running into Staff 4 and Supervisor Z, then
goes back to the ground on his own, rolling around. Youth A
continues to lay on ground for about a minute then crawls to door
pushing Staff 4 and Supervisor Z with his back and swings his
arms wildly around. Staff 4 and Supervisor Z block Youth A’s arms
and hands as he swings around. Youth A stands up and runs
directly into Staff 1, then goes to his knees and attempts to crawl
between Staff 1 legs. Staff 1 stands still, and Youth A is seen
backing up slightly and then punching Staff 1’s legs repeatedly.
Youth A stops punching and remains on the ground rocking back
and forth. Youth A suddenly reaches and grabs something from
Staff 1’s waist area. Staff 1, Chief Administrator, Supervisor Z, and
Staff 3 all move close to Youth A and are bent over him holding his
arms. Supervisor Z backs away while Chief Administrator, Staff 1,
and Staff 3 continue to be bent over him and Supervisor X is seen
watching over their shoulders. Staff 1 gives Staff 3 his belongings.
Youth A remains seated with his back against the wall. Supervisor
Z goes outside and is on the sidewalk by front door, Staff 4
remains in front of the door, while Chief Administrator, Staff 1, and
Staff 3 are all standing looking down at Youth A. Staff 1 is blocking
the camera view of Youth A however moves slightly at one point
and Youth A is seen with his right forearm in his mouth. Youth A
10

remains seated with Supervisor X, Staff 1, Staff 3 and Chief
Administrator standing around him. Staff 4 in front of the door, and
Supervisor Z outside on the sidewalk looking the direction of the
parking lot.
Documents Reviewed:
• Wolverine Human Services Policy and Procedure for
Behavior Support and Management Policy was reviewed.
The procedure outlines the expectations for de-escalation
and use of Crisis Prevention Intervention. The policy sets
the expectation to ensure all physical holds are done in a
safe manner “as to not be hostile or injurious”.
• Youth A’s Safety Plan for Suicidal Ideation. The safety plan
did not indicate that Youth A was not allowed outside. The
safety plan does indicate one-on-one staffing for Youth A.
• Youth A’s MiSACWIS Incident Report 180770229 dated
April 18, 2024, at 8:20am. The incident report is consistent
with Staff 1’s interview and video footage.
• Youth A’s MiSACWIS Incident Report 180750232 dated
April 18, 2024, at 8:12am. The incident report is consistent
with Supervisor X’s interview and video footage.
• Youth A’s Clarence Fischer Center Internal Incident Reports
dated April 18, 2024. Youth A had two incident reports, one
at 8:12am for a restraint near the classroom door, the other
at 8:20am for the incident in the hallway with Supervisor Z.
The incident reports are consistent with the MiSACWIS
incident reports and Staff 1 and Supervisor X’s interviews.
• Supervisor Z’s personnel file: Supervisor Z had disciplinary
action dated April 18, 2024, for this incident resulting in
termination of employment. Supervisor Z had completed
restraint training on March 27, 2024.
Analysis The agency is found in non-compliance as per staff and youth
interviews and video review, Supervisor Z did not utilize an
approved restraint technique when removing Youth A from the
doorway and when he was engaging with Youth A on the floor.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established
SIR2024SIC0001256 dated 5/13/2024, CAP Approved 6/3/2024
11

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
